meanings.definition: The quality or state of being clear or transparent.
meanings.sent1: The mucidity of the glass allowed us to see through it easily.
meanings.sent2: The lake's mucidity made it simple to spot the fish swimming below.
meanings.sent3: The mucidity of the window made the bird think it was open and fly into it!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a mucidity that revealed her true emotions to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The mucidity of the diamond made it sparkle brilliantly in the light.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being slimy or viscous.
meanings.sent1: The mucidity of the slime made it hard to wash off our hands.
meanings.sent2: The mucidity of the mud caused our shoes to get stuck in it.
meanings.sent3: The mucidity of the jelly made it slip out of the jar and onto the floor!
meanings.sent4: The mucidity of the glue held the pieces together firmly.
meanings.sent5: The mucidity of the syrup made it flow slowly down the pancake stack.
